moves.1. Nc3 d5 2. d4 Nf6 3. Nf3 Bf5 4. e3 e6: I try to complete the development of my pieces, even if the Bishop capture in f5 could bring me some problem.
moves.7. Bxf5 exf5 8. O-O Bd6 9. Nh4 g6: Well, I must defend the pawn in f5 even if to do it i must move the pawn ahead the castle.
moves.10. Nf3 O-O 11. a3 a5: This move is a try to push forward the Queen-side pawns.
moves.12. Qb1 Re8: I prepare the conquest of "e" column.
moves.13. Qa2 a4 14. Ne2 Nb6: Now, both two Black Knights are ready to invade the White field.
moves.15. Rfd1 Ne4 16. b3 Qe7: I try to threat the pawn in a3, after the exchage in b3.
moves.17. Qb2 Ra6 18. Bc1 Rea8 19. b4 Nc4: The attack on a3 pawn forced White to push forward b3 pawn, and allow me to put the second Knight in the middle of chessboard, attacking White pieces.
moves.20. Qa2 Qf8: Next stop for Black Queen will be h6, and threat the attack on h2.
moves.21. Rd3 Qh6 22. Rb1 b5: Now the Queen-side pawns are all right. White can start the attack against the White King.
moves.23. Ng3 Re8 24. Bb2 f6: Prevents the coming of White Knight in e5.
Black need to take its Queen off the diagonal c1-h6 threatened by the White Bishop
moves.32. Qa2 f3: And now White can't push g2-g3 because Qh3 threats a mate which White can't avoid.
moves.33. Qc2 Re7e4: Black must absolutely prevent e3-e4, because this move could block both two Black Rocks.
moves.34. Kh1 Qh4: I thought that g4-g3 would have been the definitive move, after Qh4, but....
moves.35. Kg1 g5: Now I must bring the Re8 on the "h" column threating the mate in h2.
Another pawn thrown in the first line.
moves.40. Qxf3 Rg4: Should the capture of the g3 Knight end the game?
moves.41. Qxg2 Rxg3: The Knight has fallen and the White Queen pinned on its King made me sure that the end was near.
moves.42. Re2: The last desperate try to save the game, but...
moves.42... Rh6: And the threat of the attack in h1 make Black to remis: 0-1
